intro: Heptapleurum stramineum, commonly known as the yellow-veined holly, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage with distinctive yellow veins. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are leathery, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds.
